page.title: 08Gatherley Farm & cottages
page.content: 19th C farmhouse rebuilt on old site, with two cottages built 1902 and 1937. Farmhouse is the home of the farmer, wife, 3 sons, 1 daughter. One aPhd at Imperial College, one atbicton Agricultural College.In the large cottage are the farmer's brother, wife, 2 sons, 1 electronic engineer at Reading University. Holiday cottage for fishing. Isolated cars essential. Farm mainly self-supporting, surpluses sold. Shopping Launceston, Lifton, Plymouth, Exeter. Active C of E bell ringing, WI, handicrafts, gardening, cookery judge. Concerns need for Lifton bypass. Conservation of woodland, river pollution, excessive use of fertilisers, sprays, farmers discouraged from maximising while Africa starves, changing EEC regulations impede formation of long term farming policy.
